text:
Guys, I am tracking open and click rates through our own sales engagement platform - I would like to push the open and click information to HubSpot.

Is this possible?
i.e. is it possible to write to this:
Hey I have the same issue as above i found this forum entry but no response
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Log-Email-Open-and-Click/m-p/938429/thread-id/71669>
Whaaaat! Awesome!
The account needs to have at least one hub at enterprise level.  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>
Hola buenos días
buenas buenas
Gracias por responder ..
Soy nuevo en HubSpot y en mi trabajo me pidieron hacer una integración para crear compañías y contactos ...

pero cuando cree la aplicación privada en la cuenta oficial de mi empresa, usando el mismo método, pero obviamente cambiando el token me aparece esto

Authentication credentials not found. This API supports OAuth 2.0 authentication
revise la documentación, pero no logro ordenar por donde seguir, agradecería mucho si pudieras orientarme ... para la integración estoy usando PHP
En alguna parte de la documentación hablaba de tener una cuenta de desarrollador, pero no se si es ese el camino

No necesitas cuenta de desarrollo, solo tu private app. Cuando crees tu private app, asegurate de agregar los scopes necesarios. Seguramente te sale el error "Authentication credentials not found. This API supports OAuth 2.0 authentication" porque la key que estas usando pertenece a otro portal o porque no estas enviando el header authorization correctamente
Ok, revisare cuidadosamente los datos para ver donde esta el error ... muchas gracias por tu tiempo

Need help on GraphQL please. 

I need to know if it’s possible to filter empty items out of a query result OR if it’s possible to filter an object by its association. HS docs doesn’t cover this.
Are you familiar with <https://app.HubSpot.com/graphiql/{portal_ID}>?
This will help you build out a query and see what filters are available and how to filter by association.
Here I am returing companies where address IS NOT NULL and LONG/LAT values IS NULL
When aI create a contact via the API, how do I indicate it is a marketing contact?
Thanks

hs_marketable_status = true

may need to toggle the setting in marketing contacts under the private app
Where do I find that? Are you suggesting it’s an app setting? or a scope I should request access to?
I see integrations > marketing contacts
there’s a checkbox
per <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/integrations/manage-marketing-contacts-settings-for-your-integrations>
this is so weird
I would expect it to be a parameter on the API call, not a global settings

Yeah. I had success setting that checkbox without the global setting in the api call in sandbox but when I ran this in prod I had to change the global setting . My use case was for all contacts to have this set. I do have a requirement to track down what exactly is happening here.
Are you working at HubSpot?
Nope. Built a Salesforce integration for a client recently

Just read my first response and it may have been unclear. You really should be able to check hs_marketable_status to true and have that pick up. I’d be interested if you get that working. 

Alternately, you should be able to set marketable status as true in a workflow after the contact is inserted
where would I set `hs_marketable_status` to true?
I POST to `/crm/v3/objects/contacts`
and I set firstname, lastname and email
<https://github.com/techmatters/landpotential-wp-theme/blob/main/wp-content/themes/landpks/includes/class-newsletter.php#L125>
It’s a contact property. I included it in the json body request for each contact I’m inserting
is there a API property reference somewhere?
I am looking around and don’t see it
I downloaded the contacts api into postman and pulled the properties out of there. I can take a look at the json and send a sample when I get back to the office in about 30
hijacking the conversation because this is what im trying to debug right now :smile:
The flag is still wrong  `"hs_marketable_status":"false",`
<@U06EQFWPMED> you were saying its a setting of the private app, do you mean its a scope that needs to be added?
<@U06TYMG6ZRN> not a scope - a toggle in the menu
hahahaha, you are a genius, thank you very much
This was it
NICE. I'm glad my pain over the last couple months has translated to making this a little easier for others
Well, not saying that is was worth it but sending karma your way :smile:

Hello, bear with me with this request as I am not a developer but am trying to get the datetime property made available to use through an API. However, we do not have an API key. What is needed for me to have that created?

Hello John, You likely need a what HubSpot calls a Private App with the appropriate scopes related the object you are trying to pull field data from: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>
Its in propertiesWithHistory. JS to get this done attached above.

Thanks Bill. Ive gone ahead and created the private app and api key, however when I try to test the property creation I get this warning. This might be a little too in the weeds but I dont have enough knowledge to tell if this could change anything in our account.
Hi John, Can you take a larger screenshot of which endpoint you are trying to hit there?
Okay, So that endpoint is used to create the actual property you would store data in.

If you need to create a property I would use the user interface to do it! <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/properties/create-and-edit-properties#create-a-custom-property|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/properties/create-and-edit-properties#create-a-custom-property>

I would love to just be able to do that, however the property data we need is the exact time of day an event occurred. The custom properties out of the box only allow for the date, not the time of day unfortunately.
Ah. Do you want to huddle for a few minutes? I think I can help if I make sure I understand what you need!
Please!
I cant make it huddle

Bill / John - HubSpot stuff
Monday, April 8 · 6:00 – 6:30pm
Time zone: America/Chicago
Google Meet joining info
Video call link: <https://meet.google.com/weh-vrts-nja>
Or dial: ‪(US) <tel:+1662-441-3138|+1 662-441-3138>‬ PIN: ‪943 616 452‬#
More phone numbers: <https://tel.meet/weh-vrts-nja?pin=1395482058884>
Heres a google meet!
Great I can hop on now if youre free
Yes
Here now

Hey Bill, thanks again for your help on the call today - I really appreciate it. I went ahead and set it up and it looks like the custom code block is working properly, I tested it. I went ahead and submitted a live form on our site to test if the property was updated and it was not. Screen recording attached. Don't worry about addressing this today, I know its evening time over there.
What's the best way to get the API response to show info that means something in the console for node.js custom code actions?
Hi John, I think its because the “Copy Property From” field should be the datetime field from the custom coded action.
What does console.log(JSON.stringify(apiResponseDeal)) give you?

Hello group, do you know how I can associate a custom object with a deal?
the fullyQualifiedName of my custom object is p39872653_m_dicos and the id of the record that I have in my custom object is 12560964122
but I want to associate this one with the deal with id 15957634221 via API but when I try with
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/associations/p39872653_m_dicos/deal/batch/create> it returns a 404, you know what? Is it necessary or will they know the correct way to associate them?
